description.value: ImplementationGuide for HL7 Belgium Medication Work Group
Medication Dispense
Medication Record / Medication Schema
Terminology and Vocabulary
Medication Dispense entry - information captured when dispensing medication e.g. in pharmacies and hospitals
Medication Dispense entry - information captured when dispensing medication e.g. in pharmacies and hospitals
Medication Record - summary or detailed information about the usage of medication by a patient
NIHDI identifier for care organizations
NIHDI identifier for care professionals

Medication Dispense Example 2 - a simple example of a dispensation in a pharmacy - with a geolocation
Overview of the patient's medication

Extension for connecting several resources to a single Treatment Line
A model for representing a product order.
A model for representing medication usage.
The profile for Medication Administration in a Medication Record - a record of a single administration event
The profile for Medication Treatment Line - a single recorded item/line of a medication treatment
Valueset - Medication Summary types
A model for representing a product dispense.
The profile for Medication Record

A model for representing a Treatment Line.

The profile for how to organize the information in a medication Record
A model for representing a summary view of a patient's medication.
The profile for Medication Usage in a Medication Record - a record of a single administration event

A model for a record of a single planned administration event.
A model for representing a Treatment.
A model for a structure collection of a patient's medication history.
A model for representing and reporting an administration of a product.
Value set for substituting a medication on dispense.
The profile for Medication Prescription in a Medication Record - a record of a order or request for a medication or a change of medication, implicit or explicit

title.value: Pattern 1 - Consult a patient's medication record
Pattern 2 - update a patient's medication record
Prescribed branded medication is changed by another branded medication from the same VOS-cluster
Prescribed medication is changed by another medication from a different VOS-cluster - different strength
Prescribed medication is changed by another medication from a different VOS-cluster - Different package size
Dispense medication before the prescription is available
Dispense of prescribed medication and of a product that can be dispensed without a prescription
Dispense of new brand medication that is given because the old is unavailable, so giving to continue the treatment and not to replace it

Dispense of medication that was prescribed to take if needed, but was not taken
Dispense of medication that was prescribed, but not taken till the end
